{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child has a vascular plaque along the ophthalmic and maxillary divisions of the trigeminal nerve, which is a characteristic feature of Sturge Weber syndrome. This syndrome is a neurocutaneous disorder and is often present at birth. The other options like Infantile hemangioma, Congenital hemangioma, and Proteus syndrome do not typically present with this specific feature.", "answer_choice": "A"}
